SEARCH
Package ReliableMulticast.Sender

Class Sender

java.lang.Object
ReliableMulticast.Sender.Sender
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public class Sender extends Object implements Runnable
The Sender class is responsible for sending data over a multicast network. It serializes and compresses the data before sending it in separate containers. It also handles retransmission requests for missing packets.

    • startSender

      public void startSender() throws InterruptedException, IOException
      Starts the sender process.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for the next object to send.
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs while sending the object.

      public void sendRetransmit(RetransmitRequest retransmitRequest)
      Sends a retransmission request for a specific container.
      Parameters:
      retransmitRequest - the retransmission request containing the dataID and the index of the missing container

    • requestRetransmit

      public void requestRetransmit(int missingContainer, String dataID)
      Requests a retransmission of a missing container for a specific data ID.
      Parameters:
      missingContainer - the missing container number
      dataID - the ID of the data for which retransmission is requested

    • sliceObject

      private Container sliceObject(int i, byte[] objectData, String objectHash, Class<?> objectClass, int numPackets)
      Slices a byte array of data into smaller parts to add into containers.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the slice
      objectData - the byte array containing the object data
      objectHash - the hash of the object
      objectClass - the class of the object
      numPackets - the total number of packets
      Returns:
      the container containing the sliced object data
